@graph.name: Milan (Milano)
@graph.tradition: Milan Fashion Week — Held twice a year, this is one of the most prestigious fashion events worldwide, showcasing Italian and international fashion designers.

@graph.name: Bergamo
@graph.tradition: Sant’Alessandro Feast — A celebration of Bergamo’s patron saint, featuring parades, food markets, and historical re-enactments.

@graph.name: Brescia
@graph.tradition: Mille Miglia — Known as the 'most beautiful race in the world,' this historical car race attracts vintage car enthusiasts from around the globe.

@graph.name: Como
@graph.tradition: Sagra di San Giovanni — Held on Lake Como, this festival celebrates St. John with a boat parade, fireworks, and a historical re-enactment.

@graph.name: Cremona
@graph.tradition: Festival of Torrone — A week-long event celebrating torrone (nougat) with historical parades, culinary events, and tasting of local varieties.

@graph.name: Lecco
@graph.tradition: Manzonian Celebrations — Dedicated to the famous Italian writer Alessandro Manzoni, with literary events, exhibitions, and performances based on his works.

@graph.name: Lodi
@graph.tradition: Fiera di San Bassiano — Honoring the patron saint San Bassiano, the event includes a traditional open-air market, local food, and festivities.

@graph.name: Mantua (Mantova)
@graph.tradition: Festivaletteratura — One of Italy's largest literary festivals, attracting writers, poets, and literature enthusiasts from across the country.

@graph.name: Monza
@graph.tradition: Italian Grand Prix — The Monza racetrack hosts this world-famous Formula 1 event, bringing together racing fans from around the world.

@graph.name: Pavia
@graph.tradition: Sagra di San Siro — Celebrated in honor of St. Syrus, the city’s patron saint, with a religious procession and cultural events.

@graph.name: Sondrio
@graph.tradition: Festa della Madonna della Sassella — A religious pilgrimage and festival held at the Madonna della Sassella sanctuary, celebrated with local food and wine.

@graph.name: Varese
@graph.tradition: Sacred Mountain (Sacro Monte) Pilgrimage — Known for the Sacro Monte di Varese, a pilgrimage route and UNESCO site that attracts visitors for both its religious and historical significance.
